'''Ainairos''' was an [[Solosimpi|Elf]] of [[Valinor]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name="Ainairos"/>

== History ==
Ainairos was one of the [[Solosimpi]] that escaped the [[Kinslaying at Alqualondë|Kinslaughter at Alqaluntë]] in which his brother was killed. As the result of this, he, along with many of his people, became bitter and resentful toward the [[Noldoli]].

When [[Manwë]] summoned the [[Valar]] and the [[Elves]] to a council about the final path of the [[Sun]] and the [[Moon]], Ainairos was the one to speak against the [[Exile of the Noldor|Exiles]] and for the concealment of Valinor, and the most that were gathered there agreed with him, desiring neither [[Melko]] nor the Noldoli to return.<ref name="Ainairos">{{LT1|IX}}, p. 208</ref>

== Etymology ==
According to [[Paul Strack]], both ''Ainairos'' and ''Oivárin'' (an earlier name for the character<ref>{{LT1|IXn}}, p. 222</ref>) seem to be in [[Solosimpilin]], however, their meaning is unclear.<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3304591683.html|articlename=ᴱT. ''Ainairos'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=23 March 2022}}</ref>
